actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

actions.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Security, International Organizations, and Human Rights

official_title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the urgency of U.S. ratification of United Nations human-rights treaties.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the United States should expeditiously ratify the: (1) International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination; (2) Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women; (3) American Convention on Human Rights; (4) International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights; (5) Convention on the Rights of the Child; (6) Optional Protocol to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights; and (7) Additional Protocol on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights to the American Convention on Human Rights.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the urgency of U.S. ratification of United Nations human-rights treaties.
